elements.label: Martensite Paste
elements.description: The sacred chrysm of the sword. Also an attractive silver-green.

elements.label: Labhitic Grains
elements.description: Labhites are the youngest of the Lionsmith's servants. When rendered to powder, they retain their potency but not their beauty.

elements.label: Skaptodon Fang
elements.description: It is rare for the Lionsmith to make skaptodons, now; but they are difficult to kill, and they live a very long time.

elements.label: Bitterblack Salts
elements.description: No ordinary chemist could produce these dark-gleaming crystals - not without the touch of the Forge.

elements.label: Xanthotic Essence
elements.description: In certain operations of the Forge, sunlight is said to overcome moonlight, as we pass from the Meniscate to the Madrugad. This essence was mercury, once, but now it's the rich gold of a summer afternoon. Pretty.

elements.label: Iotic Essence
elements.description: In the later operations of the Forge, the Madrugad yields to the true Forge of Days, and the essence begins to redden. Some day, perhaps, it will not, but for now we have this.

elements.label: Vital Pigment
elements.description: It is not usual for a red this red to survive the death of the body.

elements.label: Amaranthine Nectar
elements.description: One of the Flowermaker's many gifts. In a brighter age, it might have bestowed immortality. In this blighted History, it is still an unparalleled sweetness.

elements.label: Writhing Caul
elements.description: Lay your hand on these tattered folds and feel their warmth; leave your hand upon it, and it will explore the possibilities of embrace.

elements.label: Rose-Pearl Dust
elements.description: Pearls are sacred to the Witch-and-Sister, especially those of this colour. They have been used in protective rites, among others.

elements.label: Witch-Kissed Oil
elements.description: The formula remains unchanged since the days Hecate was worshipped at the crossways.

elements.label: True Blood of St Januarius
elements.description: The Thunderskin protected the one they called Januarius, against perils from every past. To this day his blood keeps dancing.

elements.label: The Byzantine Tinct
elements.description: The profound purple worn only in Histories where Tyrian dye was not rich enough for emperors. It is difficult to bar entry to one wearing this colour.

elements.label: Sthenic Venom
elements.description: From time to time, the Mother of Ants has also been called the Daughter of Venoms. This substance opens the body in uncountable places.

elements.label: Azoth
elements.description: Store this only in containers of a pure element, and never permit it to grow warm. Perhaps it isn't the final solvent that the alchemists sought. But it will do, for our purposes.

elements.label: Refulgin
elements.description: A white so pure that it remains visible even in utter darkness.

elements.label: Glassfinger Toxin
elements.description: 'What is within, without; what is without, within.' A poison sacred to the votaries of the Meniscate.

elements.label: Ichor Vitreous
elements.description: A pale and watchful fluid that can be gathered, sometimes, when the Door-in-the-Eye is opened.

elements.label: Piebald Pigment
elements.description: From the crushed wings of rare lepidopterans. 'Painting black, or painting white, this is the stuff that'll see you right.'

elements.label: Leathy
elements.description: A dark and syrupy liquor favoured in unnamed forest villages. 'The tongue and the eye, and now we begin! Forget your name, forget your skin.'

elements.label: Holiest Hemolymph
elements.description: Faint traces of an enigmatic substance spilt in the commission of an ancient crime, tightly sealed in a glass ampoule. 'Who will remember the barber's son?'

elements.label: Greydawn Oil
elements.description: The precise colour of the hours when one cannot sleep.

elements.label: Wolf-Snow
elements.description: Far too cold ever to melt in anything but the hottest noonday sun. It will, very gradually, consume human flesh.

elements.label: Watch-Worms
elements.description: A tiny pot of stunted, desiccated larval remnants from the First Worm War, rank with the power that inhabits dead Hours.
